intro: Sida cryptopetala, commonly known as the narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Sida cryptopetala is known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles in some regions.
